text:
Stapleton, Staten Island: A general view southeastward across the town of Stapleton and the Upper New York Bay, as seen from Pearl Street on Grymes Hill. Shown in the foreground is the colonnaded 2nd District Magistrates and Municipal Court House, at 67-71 Targee Street; in the left center is the tall clock-tower building of the Rubsam and Horrmann Brewery on Canal Street; in the center background is the United States Marine Hospital, and directly across its right wing is the Wrigley chewing gum plant; slightly to the right, at the edge of the clearance, is the four-story Mariners' Family Asylum, 119 Tompkins Avenue; the wooded area lying beyond that is Rosebank. Across the Stapleton piers and the bay is Brooklyn.

View 3 shows the United States Marine Hospital, Bay Street and Vanderbilt Avenue, seen from the campus of Wagner College.

June 23, 1937
Views 1, 2, 3

P. L. Sperr
title: Richmond:] Staten Island - Stapleton.

title: Richmond:] Staten Island - Stapleton.

text:
Stapleton, Staten Island: Three panoramic views southeast-ward across Stapleton, toward the Upper New York Bay and Brooklyn, seen from Pearl Street on Grymes Hill. In the center foreground is the 2nd District Municipal and Magistrate's Court House, at 67-71 Targee Street; in the left foreground is an ice manufacturing plant on Gordon Street and to its right is the Rubsam and Horrmann Brewery, its main building (with clock tower) being on Canal Street; in the right foreground is the United States Marine Hospital and across its right wing the Wrigley chewing gum plant; on the extreme right, on the edge of the clearance, is the Mariners' Family Asylum, 119 Tompkins Avenue. The wooded area beyond that is Rosebank. The piers facing on Murray Hulbert Avenue, begin with No. 14 counting in arithmetic progression from the left.

P. L. Sperr

June 23, 1937
Views 1, 2, 3
title: Richmond:] Staten Island - Stapleton.
